w:r.w:t: Situation : many BO reports running at once. Up to 130
wrote script to identify the number and names of reports, extracting the report name from the SQL Text
Wrote script using ASH to find how much IO certain reports were using
The surprise was how much IO reports were actually using. The highest I ever saw was 560 TB of physical IO
Now, that IO is primary against the storage cells. That's when a report uses NL to read the POSTING table, clocking up tens of thousands of smart scans.
But, althoug the data wasn't being brought back to the database layer, the storage cell disks were still being hit.
One action : removed parallel on the BO reports.
SQL IO usage (over 1000 GB physical IO)
SQL temp usage (over 500 GB temp space).
Over the next few weeks, this made a huge difference. Every time RTB saw a report using over 1000 GB of physical IO, they would kill it and get the user to check their report.
The IO on the database came down dramatically, because it seemed that many BO reports were timing out. They would run for up to 5 hours, use a huge amount of IO, and then get killed.

The user would then re-run them. So users had many reports running at once, trying to get their data. Fixing the badly performing reports meant that all reports ran better, and then the total number of simultaneous reports running came down, as everything was running quicker.
alter session set nls_timestamp_format='DY dd/mm/yyyy hh24:mi.FF';
alter session set nls_date_format='DY dd/mm/yyyy hh24:mi.SS';
(CAST(MAX(sample_time) AS DATE) - CAST( SQL_EXEC_START AS DATE)) * 60*24 etime_mins ,
and snap_id > (select min(snap_id) from dba_hist_snapshot where begin_interval_time > trunc(sysdate - &DAYS_AGO, 'DD') AND dbid = (select dbid from v$database) )
and user_id in (select user_id from dba_users where username LIKE '%BO%')
group by instance_number, user_id, session_id, session_serial#, sql_id, sql_exec_id, sql_exec_start, sql_plan_hash_value
lpad( LISTAGG(instance_number, ',') WITHIN GROUP (ORDER BY instance_number) , 20) as parallel_instances
inner join dba_users DU on DU.user_id = SM.user_id
left outer join dba_hist_sqltext DHST on DHST.sql_id = SM.sql_id

group by username, SM.sql_id, sql_exec_id, sql_exec_start, sql_plan_hash_value,regexp_substr( dbms_LOB.substr(sql_text, 300, dbms_lob.getlength(sql_text) - 300) ,q'#AppUserName='([a-z]+)',.*#', 1,1,'i', 1) , regexp_substr( dbms_LOB.substr(sql_text, 300, dbms_lob.getlength(sql_text) - 300) ,q'#AppName='(.*)',AppUserName.*#', 1,1,'i', 1)
select distinct inst_id, sql_id, sql_exec_id, sql_exec_start
AND SQL_ID IS NOT NULL AND SQL_EXEC_ID IS NOT NULL
AND SQL_ID IS NOT NULL AND SQL_EXEC_ID IS NOT NULL;
-- BO reports, summed over 1 minute interval, then getting max over 15 minute interval :
(case WHEN extract( minute from sample_time) < 15 THEN '00'
WHEN extract( minute from sample_time) < 30 THEN '15'
WHEN extract( minute from sample_time) < 45 THEN '30'
WHEN extract( minute from sample_time) < 60 THEN '45'
snap_id > (select min(snap_id) from dba_hist_snapshot where begin_interval_time > trunc(sysdate - &DAYS_AGO, 'DD') AND dbid = (select dbid from v$database))
and sql_id is not null and sql_exec_id is not null
snap_id > (select min(snap_id) from dba_hist_snapshot where begin_interval_time > trunc(sysdate - &DAYS_AGO, 'DD') AND dbid = (select dbid from v$database))
and sql_id is not null and sql_exec_id is not null
-- get all BO reports running, using v$session
LISTAGG(inst_id, ',') WITHIN GROUP (ORDER BY inst_id) parallel_instances,
sql_id is not null AND SQL_EXEC_ID IS NOT NULL
group by username, sql_id, sql_exec_id, sql_exec_start
left outer join GV$SQLAREA DHST on DHST.sql_id = SM.sql_id
left outer join sql_monitor_summary SMS on SMS.sql_id = SM.sql_id and SMS.sql_exec_id = SM.sql_exec_id and SMS.sql_exec_start = SM.sql_exec_start
LISTAGG(inst_id, ',') WITHIN GROUP (ORDER BY inst_id) parallel_instances,
sql_id is not null AND SQL_EXEC_ID IS NOT NULL
group by username, sql_id, sql_exec_id, sql_exec_start
left outer join GV$SQLAREA DHST on DHST.sql_id = SM.sql_id
